link.title: Eaton School District - Eaton, Colorado

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Eaton School District, RE-2, Eaton, Colorado

meta.name: description
meta.content: Eaton RE-2 is an award winning school district serving approximately 1900 students in five schools, three elementary, one middle, and one high school. Eaton is a short drive north of Greeley and west of Fort Collins, Colorado. Primarily an agricultural community, Eaton retains its small town charm while attracting families that work in larger towns/cities. Our proximity to Denver and Rocky Mountain National Park provides our students access to high-quality museums, outstanding amenities, interesting events, and four different colleges/universities.

Our proximity to Denver and Rocky Mountain National Park provides our students access to high-quality museums, outstanding amenities, interesting events, and four different colleges/universities.

div.h3: School Closure Until Further Notice, Remote Learning starting on March 30th.

div.p: Based on guidance from Weld County Health, the Colorado Department of Education, and the Governor’s office, Eaton School District will be closed until further notice. We will transition to Remote Learning starting on March 30th. Please contact your child's school for more information. Thank you for your support and understanding.

br.p: Supplemental food packages are on a first come, first serve basis while supplies last. One per family.

div.p: It is normal to be concerned about new diseases, and new information is coming out frequently. The best thing people can do is stay informed from reliable sources and know the facts.

div.div: No in-person learning or spring sports/activities through June 30th

April 21, 2020Dear Eaton and Galeton Community:I want to begin by thanking you for your support, patience, and grace during our transition to home-based learning. The health and well-being of your family continue to be our biggest priority. Please reach out to your principal if you need anything. Today I am sad to share that the Governor has extended the closure for in-person learning through the remainder of this school year. In addition, Dr. Wallace from the Weld County Department of Public Health has recommended we remain closed to any in-person learning or activities through June 30th at a minimum. We have been working closely with officials from Weld County throughout this health crisis. Cases of COVID-19 are still on the rise in Weld County. In-person learning would provide too great a health risk for our community at this time.“We are just not ready to bring students back until we can have a firm plan in place to do that safely,” said Dr. Mark Wallace. “We are
